title: Authorize external requests using client credentials grant
content_markdown:
Version: 8.3
On this page
Level: intermediate
**OAuth 2.0** is one of the supported authorization types in Creatio. This technology does not pass Creatio logins and passwords to external apps. Identity Service implements OAuth 2.0 in Creatio and authorizes external apps and web services you integrate with Creatio using OAuth 2.0. OAuth 2.0 also lets you restrict Creatio permissions for the integrated apps. For example, you can use OAuth 2.0 authorization to integrate webhook service, Power BI Connector, Clio, Creatio.ai add-in for Outlook with Creatio. Learn more: [official vendor documentation](https://oauth.net/2/) (OAuth 2.0).
Before you authorize external requests to Creatio, set up client credentials grant. Instructions: [Set up client credentials grant](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?ver=8.3&id=2508) (user documentation).
This article covers setup procedure to authorize external requests using client credentials grant. Creatio also supports authorization code grant. Learn more: [Authorize external requests using authorization code grant](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?ver=8.3&id=15188).
**General procedure** to authorize external requests using client credentials grant:
1. Retrieve an OAuth access token. Read more >>>
2. Access Creatio API using OAuth access token. Read more >>>
## 1\. Retrieve an OAuth access token​
Learn more: [Access Token](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-1.4) (OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework). For example, use Postman to retrieve an OAuth access token. To do this:
1. **Create a request**.
1. Add a request string. To do this, access the `/connect/token` endpoint.
Request string
POST IdentityServiceURL/connect/token  
2. Add a request body.
1. Open the **Body** tab.
2. Select `x-www-form-urlencoded` in the **Body option** parameter.
3. Fill out the parameters of the request body.
Parameter| Parameter description  
---|---  
client_id| The `ClientId` parameter value retrieved while configuring client credentials grant. Learn more: [Generate OAuth 2.0 client credentials](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?ver=8.3&id=2508&anchor=title-2508-1) (user documentation).  
client_secret| The `Client secret` parameter value retrieved while configuring client credentials grant. Learn more: [Generate OAuth 2.0 client credentials](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?ver=8.3&id=2508&anchor=title-2508-1) (user documentation).  
grant_type| OAuth 2.0 authorization type. Requires the `client_credentials` value of the `grantType` parameter to retrieve an OAuth access token for client credentials grant.  
3. Save the changes.
2. **Execute the request**.
**As a result** , the OAuth access token will be retrieved.
Response
Status: 200 OK  
{  
"access_token": "e******w",  
"expires_in": 3600,  
"token_type": "Bearer",  
"scope": "ApplicationAccess_0******2"  
}  
You can now authorize external requests to Creatio using the OAuth access token via client credentials grant.
If needed, you can **change the token lifetime for Creatio on-site**. Instructions: [Change the OAuth access token lifetime](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?ver=8.3&id=15097). To change the token lifetime for Creatio **in the cloud** , contact [Creatio support](mailto:support@creatio.com).
## 2\. Access Creatio API using OAuth access token​
You can authorize external requests using OAuth access token via client credentials grant and access Creatio data and API using, for example, OData 4, DataService, or other web services. Learn more: [Data services](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/8.x/dev/development-on-creatio-platform/category/data-services), [Creatio API documentation](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/10204500/SztHX5Qb?version=latest#0e2dd1ce-1a5d-4870-bb0b-c0cc2eb25a31), [Web services](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/8.x/dev/development-on-creatio-platform/category/web-services).
For example, use Postman to access Creatio data and API using OAuth access token via OData 4. To do this:
1. **Create a request**.
1. Add a request string. To do this, fill out the request parameters based on your business goals. For example, access Creatio data and API using OData 4.
Request string
GET CreatioURL/0/odata/Account  
2. **Connect the OAuth 2.0 authorization**.
1. Open the **Authorization** tab.
2. Fill out the authorization parameters.
Parameter| Parameter value  
---|---  
Type| OAuth 2.0  
Token| e******w  
3. Save the changes.
As a result, the auto-generated header will be added to the **Headers** tab. The header has the following parameters.
Parameter| Parameter value  
---|---  
Key| Authorization  
Value| Bearer e******w  
![](https://academy.creatio.com/sites/default/files/documentation/sdk/ru/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/IdentityService/8.0/scr_RequestHeaders.png)
3. **Execute the request**.
**As a result** , external requests will be authorized using OAuth access token and you will retrieve Creatio data using client credentials grant via OData 4.
Response
Status: 200 OK  
{  
"@odata.context": "https://[Creatio URL]/0/odata/$metadata#Account",  
"value": [  
{  
"Id": "405947d0-2ffb-4ded-8675-0475f19f5a81",  
"Name": "Accom (sample)",  
"OwnerId": "410006e1-ca4e-4502-a9ec-e54d922d2c00",

If the **token lifetime expired** , i.e., you got the **401 Unauthorized** status code, retrieve a new OAuth access token or change the token lifetime. Instructions: [Change the OAuth access token lifetime](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?ver=8.3&id=15097).
You can **set up automated monitoring systems** based on OAuth health monitoring. Instructions: [OAuth health monitoring](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?ver=8.3&id=2513) (user documentation). If needed, use **Postman** to check the health of OAuth functionality. The Postman request collection that tests requests is available in [Creatio API documentation](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/10204500/SztHX5Qb?version=latest#0e2dd1ce-1a5d-4870-bb0b-c0cc2eb25a31).
* * *
## See also​
[Set up OAuth client credentials grant](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?ver=8.3&id=2508) (user documentation)
[Change the OAuth access token lifetime](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?ver=8.3&id=15097)
[Postman basics](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?ver=8.3&id=15451)
* * *
## Resources​
[Creatio API documentation](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/10204500/SztHX5Qb?version=latest#0e2dd1ce-1a5d-4870-bb0b-c0cc2eb25a31)

code_examples.context: As a result, external requests will be authorized using OAuth access token and you will retrieve Creatio data using client credentials grant via OData 4.

rows: TheClientIdparameter value retrieved while configuring client credentials grant. Learn more:Generate OAuth 2.0 client credentials(user documentation).
TheClient secretparameter value retrieved while configuring client credentials grant. Learn more:Generate OAuth 2.0 client credentials(user documentation).
OAuth 2.0 authorization type. Requires theclient_credentialsvalue of thegrantTypeparameter to retrieve an OAuth access token for client credentials grant.
tables.html:
Parameter

Parameter description

client_id

The ClientId parameter value retrieved while configuring client credentials grant. Learn more: Generate OAuth 2.0 client credentials (user documentation).

client_secret

The Client secret parameter value retrieved while configuring client credentials grant. Learn more: Generate OAuth 2.0 client credentials (user documentation).

grant_type

OAuth 2.0 authorization type. Requires the client_credentials value of the grantType parameter to retrieve an OAuth access token for client credentials grant.

headings.text: Authorize external requests using client credentials grant
2. Access Creatio API using OAuth access token​

parameters.type: TheClientIdparameter value retrieved while configuring client credentials grant. Learn more:Generate OAuth 2.0 client credentials(user documentation).

parameters.type: TheClient secretparameter value retrieved while configuring client credentials grant. Learn more:Generate OAuth 2.0 client credentials(user documentation).

parameters.name: grant_type
parameters.type: OAuth 2.0 authorization type. Requires theclient_credentialsvalue of thegrantTypeparameter to retrieve an OAuth access token for client credentials grant.
